channel.title: Tor
channel.description: Ok, well first off im on government computers which their internet provider blocks everything. I need help getting Tor to work it wont find any relays what so ever i've tried about everything. I need a few people to try and help me with this problem, i have been trying to get through job corps new internet security for about 2 weeks now but have failed. So if any 1 wants to help it would be much apprecieated it doesnt track your dns like websens it tracks my ip so whatever i do it knows -

item.title: Tor
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:10, topic:392569”]3. It’s highly doubtful that you’re on a government computer, coming to MoparScape, asking for advice on bypassing network blocks.[/quote]Ouuch painful!

Read full topic

item.title: Tor
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

  1. Just like in reality, wherever you go, you leave a trail. However hard you may try to hide your footprints, if you dig deep enough, someone will know you were there.
  2. Tor is just like any other proxy service. And just like any other proxy services, network admins can easily check incoming/outgoing traffic. And even if they couldn’t find a trace there, they could just remove the ability to run Tor.
  3. It’s highly doubtful that you’re on a government computer, coming to MoparScape, asking for advice on bypassing network blocks.
  4. Do you even know what ping does? You sir are misinformed. When you “ping” a computer, all your doing is seeing if you can “talk” to that computer. You would find out more information via tracert.

Read full topic

Rant, do you understand the significance of what you pasted even?

It wouldn’t matter if the Tor founder was the supreme ruler of the universe or not, that attack is valid for anyone.

item.title: Tor
item.dc:creator: @rant rant
item.description:
@rant wrote:

[quote=“Gameboy223, post:4, topic:392569”]Tor is widly used it is the ultimate proxy… if u actually read about it you would be suprised. it pings your ip address all around the world to diffrent servers

The thing of it is im not at home im sitting here in job corps… otherwise i would use team viewer[/quote]
well tor is being monitored by the government due to affiliation with wikileaks… the guy who made it is practically the co-owner of wikileaks, i heard most of this on coast to coast am and the john batchelor show here in texas so it is official new information.

Read full topic

item.title: Tor
item.dc:creator: @rant rant
item.description:
@rant wrote:

this is the most stupid fucking idea i’ve hear of in a while, no offense aimed at you personally. Do you have any idea who created tor?

anonymous, not so much…

Like all current low latency anonymity networks, Tor cannot and does not attempt to protect against monitoring of traffic at the boundaries of the Tor network, i.e., the traffic entering and exiting the network. While Tor does provide protection against traffic analysis, it cannot prevent traffic confirmation (also called end-to-end correlation).[23][24]

Read full topic
